string.text: A 12-caliber cartridge, equipped with a shot with a diameter of 5 mm (40pcs). At close distances, it has a huge slaughter and stopping action. Designed for shooting only from smoothbore weapons.

A cartridge of the 12th caliber with a non-wrestled bullet. It is usually used for hunting large animals, but is also suitable for other purposes: its heavy bullet weighing 39 grams does not break through, but actually pushes body armor.
Bullet-Drotik. The plumage stabilizes the bullet, which increases the accuracy of the battle. A massive steel body of a bullet can break through any body armor.

An ordinary cartridge of the 20th caliber, equipped with a fraction with a diameter of 6 mm. At close distances, it has a huge slaughter and stopping action. Designed for shooting only from smoothbore weapons.

In 1951, a 9 -mm pistol of the Makarov system and the cartridge for it - 9x18 mm were accepted into service with the Soviet Army. A bullet with a steel core in a lead shirt gives a lead saving and increases the ability to break through non -metallic barriers, but it is not able to break through a bulletproof vest with steel plates.

Armor -piercing cartridge with pulse and dimensions of the "native" cartridge 9x18 PM. Designed by the Tula KBP. At a distance of 11 meters with a 100% probability, a bulletproof vest with a 2.4 mm armored plate and a Kevlar sublayer breaks through, and at a distance of 30 meters - a titanium plate with a thickness of 1.25 mm and 30 layers of Kevlar fabric.

The cartridge 9 MM Parabellum (on the North American continent, the more known under the name of his creator - George Lyger - “9 Mm Luger”) is the only cartridge that has earned his life to be called “9 mm cartridge” over his centuries. Good ballistic qualities of the 9x19 cartridge made it standard ammunition for pistols and machine guns in most countries of the world.

One of the reinforced modifications of the cartridge 9 mm Parabellum - 9x19 +P +, i.e. The pressure in the barrel channel is very high - this type of cartridge is used in the police, less often in "civilian" pistols. Effective against armored targets.

5.7x28 mm SS190 - pistol cartridge created in 1986 for a replacement of 9x19 mm Parabellum. Compared to a 9x19 mm cartridge, it provides a greater decoration of firing, lower return, greater effective firing range, armor penetration, and also differs in a reduced degree of ricochet. This cartridge occupied a niche between pistol and intermediate (automatic) cartridges. The 5.7x28 mm cartridge is used in the Personal Defense Weapon) UN P90 and the FN FIVE-SEVEN pistol.
5.7x28 SS195 JHP - a cartridge with an expansive bullet, has less piercing ability than SS190, but with a large stopping effect and slaughter force.

.50 Action Express (also .50 AE, 12.7 x 33, 12.7x32.6 mm) - a cartridge developed in 1988 for the Israeli Pistol Desert Eagle. One of the most powerful unitary pistol cartridges in the world. It has a stupid bullet that determines the huge stopping effect of this cartridge.
Magnum (Latin Magnum, from Magnus - large, great) - a cartridge of high power compared to the usual cartridge of the same caliber. Also, weapons intended for a cartridge of this type.

The .45ACP caliber (Automatic Colt Pistol) with a shell bullet has remained popular for more than a hundred years. A heavy bullet with a relatively weak powder charge has not too much speed, but has a significant stopping effect. It is applied against personnel and light non -darled equipment.

The .45ACP caliber (Automatic Colt Pistol) with the Hydra-Shok bullet from Federal is known for its high stopping action, for many years, being the standard for ammunition in this caliber. Hydra-Shok remains a good choice today.

Standard army cartridge 5.45x39 mm (index 7N10). Due to the decrease in the impulse of the return and an increase in the initial speed of the bullet, the cartridge provides higher combat accuracy than its predecessor 7.62x39 mm.
Army cartridge of 5.45x39 mm caliber with armor -piercing bullet (Index 7N22). Inside the bullet there is a carbide armor -piercing core. Effective against body armor.

The cartridge with a heavy bullet under the designation SS109 was developed in Belgium in Belgium at Fabrique National (initially it was developed for the FN FNC assault rifle and the FN Minimi light machine gun). By the mid-1980s, this cartridge was accepted as standard for all NATO countries.

The NATO cartridge of 5.56x45 mm caliber with an armor -piercing bullet of increased penetrating ability. Known under the P112 index. Effective against body armor. It is widely used in small arms of the armies and special services of NATO countries.

Special sniper cartridge. It has a dos purpose of flight, which allows it to be used in silent weapons for special operations. Thanks to the caliber, it is distinguished by a high stopping action, and due to a heavy bullet of a special design, most bulletproof vestments are piercing at ranges up to 200 meters.

Cheap modification of a special armor -piercing cartridge. It has a subsonic flight speed, which allows you to use it in silent weapons for special operations. A thermomed steel core is used in the design of the bullet, which allows you to break through most body armor at ranges up to 200 meters. Due to the too high pressure of powder gases, it is not recommended for the use of the VAL AS and the Rifle Rifle Rifle in the AC.

A special cartridge with armor -piercing bullet. It has a subsonic flight speed, which allows you to use it in silent weapons for special operations. Thanks to the caliber, it is distinguished by a high stopping action, and due to the special design of the bullet - a partially open core made of hardened steel, pierces most body armor at ranges up to 400 meters.
Soviet pistol cartridge 7.62mm caliber. A simple whole -shell bullet with a lead core.
Soviet pistol cartridge 7.62mm caliber. A bullet with a steel core, improved armor -piercing.
Soviet automatic cartridge of 7.62mm caliber (index 57-N-231). Simple shell with a steel core.
Soviet armor -piercing automatic cartridge of caliber 7.62mm (index 7N23). A bullet with a heat -sophisticated core of instrumental steel, improved armor -piercing.
Rifle ammunition of the NATO standard. Caliber - 7.62mm. Simple shell with a lead core.
Patro 7.62x51 mm in the NATO M61 AP
Rifle armor -piercing ammunition of the NATO standard. Caliber - 7.62mm. A bullet with a steel core, improved armor -piercing.
A regular army sniper cartridge 7.62x54 mm PS (Index 7N1). The cartridge bullet has a stupid steel core. Cheap in the manufacture of a modification of a sniper cartridge for sniper rifles.

A specially designed sniper armor -piercing cartridge 7.62x54 mm SNB (index 7N14). By accuracy of shooting, it is equal to the sniper cartridge 7N1, but significantly exceeds it in armor -piercing effect due to the introduction of a pointed hardened steel core into the design of the bullet.

A cartridge with armor -piercing bullet 7.62x54 mm BP (Index 7N26). It has a bullet design of a core made of hardened instrumental steel. Designed to defeat manpower, located behind the light armor shelters, at ranges up to 500 m.
The 8x57 IS cartridge was the main cartridge of the German army during the First World War and the Second World War.

The most widespread in the German army was a cartridge with a heavy pointed S.S bullet (Schweres Spitzgeschoss) weighing 12.8 grams. It was intended for shooting from easel, hand machine guns, rifles and carbines, which were in service with the Wehrmacht.
It was created as a special sniper cartridge for large -distance shooting, but at the moment it is also widely used by hunters and arrows athletes.

12.7x55 mm SC -130 - Russian rifle ammunition with a subsonic bullet speed created in the Central Committee for the Low Small and Free Damage of Protected targets and manpower in heavy body armor in ranges up to 600 meters.

12.7x99 mm (known for the designations ".50 BMG", "12.7x99 MM NATO") - a large -caliber cartridge of NATO armies. It was created in the 1920s as an ammunition for a large-caliber machine gun Browning M1921. After the Second World War, the cartridge is standardized in NATO and is produced by various NATO participating countries under unified technical conditions.

The cassette consisting of damaging and energy ellents for the Gauss impulse electric magnetic rifle. As damaging elements, 2mm capsules are used. The source of energy is a capsulated fragment of the “flash” artifact.
Cassette for the pulse electric magnetic rifle "Gauss" of a reduced capacity. The reduced capacity is due to the artisanal conditions of the manufacture of elements.

A cartridge with a bullet of increased penetration. In the design of the bullet has an armor -piercing core made of hardened instrumental steel. Designed to defeat manpower, located behind the light armor shelters, at ranges up to 500 m.

Fragmentation-fluid anti-personnel grenade "Pencil" ("Shard"). Allows you to amaze the covered enemy at a distance exceeding the range of a hand grenade. It is equally effective both against manpower and against easily armored technology.
A manual defensive grenade, its fragments are able to break through medium -sized body armor in a radius of 20 m.
Offensive hand grenade with a small radius of defeat. The radius of the lesion by an explosive wave is about 5 m.
Hand smoke grenade. Designed to install a smoke curtain. The curtain formation time is 10 seconds.
Chemical lighting grenade. Designed to illuminate areas of the terrain during night battle, as well as for blinding and disorientation of the enemy. The action of the action is less than a minute.
40mm shot VOG-25 (7P17) in its device is unitary and made according to the "flagils" scheme, i.e. The throwing charge, along with the ignition agent, is located in the bottom of the grenade body.

40mm UG -25P or “SUPPLISH” (7P24) is a fragmentation grenade for grenade launchers, which has the main and main difference in the head fuse that provides “bouncing” the grenade after a blow to the soil and its rupture in the air, which increases its amazing effect.
Type of shots for grenade launchers of 40mm caliber, which are in service with NATO. Designed to defeat goals in shelter.
Optical sight for the Israeli machine Imi.
Optical and variable increase sights are installed on a hunting rifled weapon and are designed for aiming aiming in it during firing. On weapons, sights are mounted using special brackets.

The 1P78 sight is designed to equip machine guns and hand machine guns. The sight has a frequency of 2.8x, the optical scheme is similar to the sight 1P77. Developed by the Central Design Bureau "Told" (Novosibirsk), the chief designer - S.I. Mikhalenko.

Designed for observation and conducting aiming in the dark in the light of stars and moon. It is installed on all types of small arms with the side bar of the mount - AK74, AK74M, AK101, AK102, AK105, AK107, AK108, AN94, Sniper rifles AS, ASS.

The night sight 1PN93-4 for the SVD sniper rifle is designed to observe the battlefield and conduct aiming at the conditions of natural night lighting at a temperature of the environment from plus 50 ° C to minus 50 ° C and relative humidity up to 100% (at a temperature of 25 ° C).

The Saracens sight is one of the latest developments of the Novosibirsk Instrument -Building Plant, and has been produced in series since 2011. Its distinctive feature is small weight (670 gr.) And dimensions. In this case, the sight of the sight is made of metal. The sight is equipped with an eop of generation 2+ or 3.

The scope of the cobra provides confident aiming in conditions of natural light (bright sunny day, deep twilight and lunar night) due to the presence of 16 levels of manual adjustment of the brightness of the sighting brand. The location of the aiming brand and the target in one plane allows you to aiming both one and two eyes, which is created for the shooter by an unlimited field of view, and to conduct effective speed firing at a rapidly moving, small and suddenly appearing targets.

The original design of OKP sights makes it possible to conduct targeted fire from unstable positions and in conditions of rapidly changing environment, reduces fatigue, and also, if necessary, allows the use of a standard mechanical device. The main feature of the sight is the reflector attachment without a mechanical frame that blocks the noticeable part of the shelling sectors. The protection of the reflector in extreme conditions is provided by a thin and durable metal visor, which practically does not interfere with firing.
EO Tech is a world leader and an exclusive manufacturer of holographic aiming system for small arms.

A collimator sight of the open type “C-More Railway” can be instantly installed on the fastening “Weaver” or “Picatinny”. Therefore, such a sight can be used with almost any weapon - a shotgun, a rifle, a revolver, a crossbow, a paintball and airsoft gun. The sight of the sight is made of aluminum.

DOCTER collimator sights are excellent optical sights of a modern structure. Due to its small size and mass, as well as a compact unquestioning structure, these sights provide rich possibilities for using both hunting and sports. Reliable performance, high optical power, attractive design and reliability of work, even with extreme weather conditions, make the Docter Sight sight indispensable.

The collimator sight of PC -A is a modern light, hermetic, easy to master the sight for hunting carbines “Tiger”, which have a side bar for installing optical sights. The sight is intended for the exact guidance of weapons AK74N, RPK74N, AKMN-1, RPKN-1 when shooting in various lighting conditions-in the daytime, at dusk, in conditions of poor visibility and rapidly changing illumination. The sight is sealed and filled with dry nitrogen in order to avoid fogging of internal optical surfaces.
A compact sight for small arms developed and produced by the Swedish company Aimpoint M68 AB.
An optical sight with a variable multiplicity, designed to replace the 4-multiple of Acog from Trijicon.

The collimator sight Electro Sight 1x22x33 for quick aiming. Shockproof, suitable for all types of weapons with a picatini bar. The choice of the brightness level of the lights of the aiming brand (7 steps) allows you to use the sight at various levels of illumination.
Closed collimator sight Barska Red Dot 2x30mm. Multilayer enlightenment of optics, 100% water resistance, resistant to fogging. Suitable for all types of weapons having a Picatinny bar.
Widely distributed optical sight of Soviet production. For installation on the weapon, a “swallow tail” type is used.
PSO -1M2 - for targeted shooting from a sniper rifle Dragunov SVD 7.62. The aiming scales are designed for shooting from 100 m to 1300 m.

PSO-1M2-01-a sight for aimed shooting from a special sniper rifle (rifled) of a 9 mm caliber and a special assault rifle 9 mm. The aiming scales are designed for shooting from 100 m to 400 meters (step 50 meters). For shooting at dusk in the sights, the grid illumination is provided. As a power source, a standard AA type battery is used instead of the 2RC63 battery.
PU (from the sight of shortened) is a Soviet optical sight originally created in 1940.
The sight of the 1939 release for the Mauser 98K rifle.

Optical sight of fixed multiplicity (2.7 diopters). Optimized for the battle at medium distances, as well as for use in urban development. For installation on the weapon, a “swallow tail” type is used.
The electronic-optical device of passive action 1PN58 (NSMUM-2) is designed to observe and ensure targeted shooting at night. For installation on the weapon, a “swallow tail” type is used.

The sight has a variable increase in the increase and the device of capture and illumination of the target. Designed for use by special -purpose groups. For installation on the weapon, a “swallow tail” type is used.

The optical sight SUSAT L9A1 - Sight Unit, Small Arms, Trilux (aiming device for small weapons with "Trilyux" lighting). Most often used for conducting aimed fire from light small arms at medium and large distances. Installed on the Picatinny bar.

Optical sight Acog, Trilux (aiming device for small weapons with the “Trilyux” backlight). Most often used to conduct targeted fire from light small arms at small and medium distances. Installed on the Picatinny bar.

Optical sight Acog -D - Trilux, DUSK (aiming device for small weapons with a “trilyux” backlight for ples). Designed to conduct close combat in conditions of insufficient light. Installed on the Picatinny bar.

The optical sight of Acog -N - Trilux, Night (aiming device for small weapons with a “Trilyux” backlight with an integrated night vision device). Designed for fighting in the absence of light sources. Installed on the Picatinny bar.

The optical sight of Acog -RF - Trilux, Rangefinder (aiming device for small weapons with a Trilyux backlight with a rangefinder of customizable multiplicity). Allows you to independently adjust the multiplicity to increase the accuracy of firing. Installed on the Picatinny bar.
A device for silent and free shooting for pistols and gunners of 9mm caliber.
Silent shooting device for PB pistol (6P9).
The device for silent shooting for automatic machines SP-3M "Whirlwind" and OSK-94.
The device for silent shooting for the FN Five-Even pistol.
A device for silent shooting for APS and OC-33 Pernach pistols.
The device of silent shooting for pistols and pistols-machine guns of the 45th caliber.

The muffler of the tactical automatic (hereinafter referred to as the ATH muffler) is designed to reduce the sound and firing of the shot when shooting from 5.56 mm assault rifles Kalashnikov AK101 and AK102, as well as 7.62 mm Kalashnikov AK103 and AK104.

Tactical muffler “TGP-A-5.45” for 5.45 mm AK series and RPK-74 machine guns. There is no rubber shutter in the muffler design and there is no need to use cartridges with a subsonic bullet speed. However, the accuracy of the shooting during its installation is slightly deteriorating.

The muffler-plame-tactical plameg for the SVD ("TGP-B"). It can be installed on SVD on top of the standard slit cylindrical flame arrester. Destination - ensuring the masking of the arrow position (daytime, night time), reducing the intensity of the sound of the shot and an almost complete exclusion of the outbreak. Reducing the sound effect on the shooter (exclusion of stunning in closed rooms).
The moderator of the sound of a shot from Haexagon, is designed for carbines and rifles of 12 caliber.

PBS-1. A device for silent and free shooting from a Kalashnikov assault rifle of 7.62 mm caliber. When installing the muffler, the shooting is carried out by the cartridges of the mustache with the subsonic speed of the bullet.
PBS-4. A device for silent and free shooting from a 5.45-mm Kalashnikov Shuttered (AKS-74U) machine gun.
The AAC M4-2000 model muffler is designed to install 5.56x45 mm caliber machines and carabiners.
The AAC 762-SDN-6 muffler is designed for use with a caliber 7.62x51 NATO.
A silencer for some sniper rifles, including Remington 700, M24, Barrett M98B, SV-98.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Wog-25 shot, VOG-25P \ n \ N, a single-charged, loaded with a grenade launcher, a sub-barrel for machine guns used in the Warsaw Contract countries. Sprinking mechanism is self-willed, with a manual fuse and automatic locking of a shot when installed improperly.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Wog-25 shot, VOG-25P \ n \ n under-barrel grenade launcher GP-34 was developed on the basis of the Army GP-30 HP-30 shoe in the early 2000s in the Izhmash design bureau. The new grenade launcher (by the way the first and only, developed on Izhmash) was developed as a competitor to the Tula GP-30M “shoe” and is designed to install Kalashnikov's full-sized automatic machines: AK-74M, modern “hundredth series”, An-94 Abakan, AK-971, as well as for the latest AK-12. It is in service with the Armed Forces and the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation, and is exported.
\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Shot M397A1 \ N \ N Up -barn a single -charged grenade launcher with mounting on the Picatinny bar.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Shot M397A1 \ N \ N Under -barrel grenade launcher M320 was created to replace the under -barrel grenade launcher M203. The Picatinsky Arsenal has been made a competition for a new 40 mm under -barrel grenade launcher. The competition was won by Heckler & Koch in early 2006. The M320 was made on the basis of the HECKLER & KOCH Be, but they are not completely identical. Production was started in November 2008. The grenade launcher was officially represented in July 2009 at Fort Bragg (North Carolina) with the 1st brigade of the 82nd Airborne Division of the United States.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Shot M397A1 \ N \ N Pod -barrel grenade launcher developed by the German weapon concern Heckler & amp; Koch for replacing HK 79. The main platform for it is the HK G36 rifle.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Shot M397A1 \ N \ N FN40GL is a modification of the FN GL1 grenade launcher, adapted for use in the FN SCAR assault rifles. По конструкции гранатомет FN40GL является однозарядным, нарезным оружием, выполненным по ставшей традиционной схеме с подвижным стволом.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] sights of the ECP-8-02 cobra, 1P29 Tulip, PSO-1M2-01 \ N \ N %C [255,255,255] • %C [default] murder 9x39mm \ n \ n automation 9A-91 is based on the removal of powder gases from the barrel. The locking is carried out by turning the shutter, on 4 combat stops. UM - a trigger type, allows you to fire solitary and continuous bursts.

The Croatian submachine gun, created in the initial period of the Civil War in Yugoslavia. It was used by self-defense units, partisan-pure and sabotage-terrorist formations, as well as some units of the Croatian army, but was not officially adopted. The submachine gun turned out to be popular among criminals, since the weapon produced in wartime was not shot for the Pulegilzothek of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and (except for individual exhibition samples) did not even have labeling.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Muffler for APS \ N \ N \ N 9-mm Automatic Pistol Stechkin-an automatic gun developed in the late 1940s-early 1950s by the designer I. Ya. Stechkin and adopted by the Armed Forces of the USSR in 1951, simultaneously with the Makarov pistol. APS is intended for weapons of officers who are directly involved in hostilities, as well as for soldiers and sergeants of some special units.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] sights of ECP-8-02 cobra, 1P78 Cashtan, 1PN93-1, OKP-7 \ N \ N \ N %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [defult] under-barrel grenade launcher GP-25 \ n \ n a modern machine developed to replace the obsolete AK-74. One of the main features is the possibility of firing with bursts of 2 cartridges with high accuracy (at a distance of a hundred meters, both bullets lie at one point). This significantly increases the chances of impressing the target thanks to the aggregate stopping and piercing action of bullets.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] ACOG sights, Barska ES AC10632, EOTECH \ N \ N %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFAULT] AAC M4-2000 \ N \ N \ N GALIL ACE - The Israeli family of automatic weapons, the further development of the Galil machine (in turn, which is the "descendant" of the Kalashnikov assault rifle).

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] ACOG, AIMPOINT M68, BARSKA ES AC10632, EOTECH, 1PN23 SARACIN \ N \ N \ N E %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] MISHER AAC 762 SDN -6 \ N \ N GALIL ACE - Israeli Automatic Weapon Family, further development of the Galil machine (in turn, which is a “descendant” of Kalashnikov's automatic machine).

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] muffler 9mm \ n \ n AK-919K “Kashtan”-a Russian machine gun, developed in the mid-1990s, employees of the SKB of the Kovrovsky Mechanical Plant (leading designer-Pavel Sedov, supervisor Mikhail Tarasov, with the support of the head of the SKBB SKBB. Stanislav Koksharova). The Austrian Steyr MPI-69 submachine gun was taken as a sample, however, after the release of the AEK-919 experimental batch, shortcomings were discovered, after which changes were made to the basic design. The updated sample received the AK-919K index.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] sights of ECP-8-02 cobra, 1P78 Cashtan, 1PN93-1, OKP-7 \ N \ N \ N %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [defult] under-barrel grenade launcher GP-25 \ n \ n \ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] mulber TGP-A \ n \ n the machine is made according to the traditional layout (the front position of the store) and constructively repeats the Kalashnikov assault rifle-the swing and automation of reloading based on the gas engine is used. The machine is designed for cartridges with a caliber of 5.45x39 mm, there are also options for this machine for a cartridge of 5.56 mm NATO (AEK-972) and 7.62x39 mm (AEK-973).

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] sights of ECP-8-02 cobra, 1P78 Cashtan, 1PN93-1, OKP-7 \ N \ N \ N %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [defult] under-barrel grenade launcher GP-25 \ n \ n \ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] mulber TGP-A \ n \ n the machine is made according to the traditional layout (the front position of the store) and constructively repeats the Kalashnikov assault rifle-the swing and automation of reloading based on the gas engine is used. The machine is designed for cartridges with a caliber of 7.62x39 mm, there are also options for this machine for a cartridge of 5.45x39 mm (AEK-971) and 5.56 mm NATO (AEK-972).

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] ACOG, AIMPOINT M68, BARSKA ES AC10632, EOTECH, 1PN23 SARACIN \ N \ N \ N E %c[255,1,255,255]•%c[default] Подствольный гранатомёт ГП-34 
 
 
 %c[255,1,255,255]•%c[default] Глушитель ТГП-А 
 
 АК-12 - автомат Калашникова образца 2012 года, перспективная разработка концерна "Kalashnikov." The development of a new machine was carried out in initiative from June 2011 under the leadership of the chief designer of Izhmash Vladimir Viktorovich Zlobin based on the works in the previous 10 years. In 2011, the assembly was completed and the test of the first prototype of the fifth-generation Kalashnikov machine with the working name AK-12 was launched.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] ACOG, AIMPOINT M68, BARSKA ES AC10632, EOTECH, 1PN23 SARACIN \ N \ N \ N E %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] TGP-A \ N \ N \ N AK-12 is a fundamentally new machine, implemented using the general scheme and technical solutions of the former Kalashnikov machine guns. This sample is equipped with a tactical handle and a store for 45 rounds.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Setting sights is impossible due to the lack of mounting “Lastochkin tail” \ n \ n \ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [default] Supporting grenade launcher GP-25 \ N \ N \ N E %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] SUMPLE PBS-1 \ N \ N \ N 7.62 mm Kalashnikov automatic (AK)-an automatic machine adopted in the USSR in 1949. AK and its modifications are the most common small arms in the world. According to available estimates, to this type (including licensed and unlicensed copies, as well as third -party developments based on AK), belongs to 1/5 of the total shooting firearms on Earth.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Setting sights is impossible due to the lack of mounting “Lastochkin tail” \ n \ n \ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [default] Supporting grenade launcher GP-25 \ N \ N \ N E %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] SUMPLE PBS-1 \ N \ N AKS (Grau index-56-A-212M)-AK with a folding metal butt intended for airborne troops. Was accepted simultaneously with AK. Initially produced with a stamped receiver, and since 1951 - milled due to a high percentage of marriage during stamping.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] sights of ECP-8-02 cobra, 1P78 Cashtan, 1PN93-1, OKP-7 \ N \ N \ N %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [defult] under-barrel grenade launcher GP-34 \ n \ n \ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] mulisure of TGP-A \ n \ n \ n automatic Kalashnikov caliber 5.45 mm, developed in 1970 by the designer M. T. Kalashnikov and adopted by the Armed Forces of the USSR in 1974. It is the further development of AKM. The development of the AK-74 is associated with the transition to a new low-income cartridge of 5.45x39 mm.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] Setting sights is impossible due to the lack of mounting “Lastochkin tail” \ n \ n \ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [default] Supporting grenade launcher GP-25 \ N \ N \ N E %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] MLASHIC TGP-A \ N \ N Kalashnikov A caliber 5.45 mm, developed in 1970 by designer M. T. Kalashnikov and adopted by the Armed Forces of the USSR in 1974. It is the further development of AKM. The development of the AK-74 is associated with the transition to a new low-income cartridge of 5.45x39 mm.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] molter TGP-A \ N \ N \ N venue of Kalashnikov caliber 5.45 mm, equipped with tactical forearm, a handle, a KV-04 strip with an OKP-7 sight and an enlarged store by 45 rounds.

\ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [DeFULT] sights of ECP-8-02 cobra, 1P78 Cashtan, 1PN93-1, OKP-7 \ N \ N \ N %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [defult] under-barrel grenade launcher GP-25 \ n \ n \ n %C [255,1,255,255] • %C [Default] mulberry TGP-A \ N \ N AK-74M-AK-74 modernized.
